mac-address.description:
Assigns a MAC address to the Ethernet interface.  If not
specified, the corresponding operational state leaf is
expected to show the system-assigned MAC address.

auto-negotiate.description:
Set to TRUE to request the interface to auto-negotiate
transmission parameters with its peer interface.  When
set to FALSE, the transmission parameters are specified
manually.

duplex-mode.description:
When auto-negotiate is TRUE, this optionally sets the
duplex mode that will be advertised to the peer.  If
unspecified, the interface should negotiate the duplex mode
directly (typically full-duplex).  When auto-negotiate is
FALSE, this sets the duplex mode on the interface directly.

port-speed.description:
When auto-negotiate is TRUE, this optionally sets the
port-speed mode that will be advertised to the peer for
negotiation.  If unspecified, it is expected that the
interface will select the highest speed available based on
negotiation.  When auto-negotiate is set to FALSE, sets the
link speed to a fixed value -- supported values are defined
by ETHERNET_SPEED identities

enable-flow-control.description:
Enable or disable flow control for this interface.
Ethernet flow control is a mechanism by which a receiver
may send PAUSE frames to a sender to stop transmission for
a specified time.

This setting should override auto-negotiated flow control
settings.  If left unspecified, and auto-negotiate is TRUE,
flow control mode is negotiated with the peer interface.

in-mac-control-frames.description: MAC layer control frames received on the interface

in-mac-pause-frames.description: MAC layer PAUSE frames received on the interface

in-oversize-frames.description:
The total number of frames received that were
longer than 1518 octets (excluding framing bits,
but including FCS octets) and were otherwise
well formed.

in-undersize-frames.description:
The total number of frames received that were
less than 64 octets long (excluding framing bits,
but including FCS octets) and were otherwise well
formed.

in-jabber-frames.description:
Number of jabber frames received on the
interface.  Jabber frames are typically defined as oversize
frames which also have a bad CRC.  Implementations may use
slightly different definitions of what constitutes a jabber
frame.  Often indicative of a NIC hardware problem.

in-fragment-frames.description:
The total number of frames received that were less than
64 octets in length (excluding framing bits but including
FCS octets) and had either a bad Frame Check Sequence
(FCS) with an integral number of octets (FCS Error) or a
bad FCS with a non-integral number of octets (Alignment
Error).

in-8021q-frames.description: Number of 802.1q tagged frames received on the interface

in-crc-errors.description:
The total number of frames received that
had a length (excluding framing bits, but
including FCS octets) of between 64 and 1518
octets, inclusive, but had either a bad
Frame Check Sequence (FCS) with an integral
number of octets (FCS Error) or a bad FCS with
a non-integral number of octets (Alignment Error)

in-block-errors.description:
The number of received errored blocks. Error detection codes
are capable of detecting whether one or more errors have
occurred in a given sequence of bits – the block. It is
normally not possible to determine the exact number of errored
bits within the block

out-mac-control-frames.description: MAC layer control frames sent on the interface

out-mac-pause-frames.description: MAC layer PAUSE frames sent on the interface

out-8021q-frames.description: Number of 802.1q tagged frames sent on the interface

ethernet-interface-state.description: Grouping for defining Ethernet-specific operational state

hw-mac-address.description:
Represenets the 'burned-in',  or system-assigned, MAC
address for the Ethernet interface.

negotiated-duplex-mode.description:
When auto-negotiate is set to TRUE, and the interface has
completed auto-negotiation with the remote peer, this value
shows the duplex mode that has been negotiated.

negotiated-port-speed.description:
When auto-negotiate is set to TRUE, and the interface has
completed auto-negotiation with the remote peer, this value
shows the interface speed that has been negotiated.

ethernet-top.description: top-level Ethernet config and state containers

ethernet.description:
Top-level container for ethernet configuration
and state
